channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Know About How an Affirmative Action Ban Affected Colleges
item.description: Here is what we know about the effects of the Supreme Court’s decision curtailing race-based admissions at selective universities. And why many expert...

item.title: I’m a founder—and ‘founder mode’ is missing a key to growth
item.description: C-level executives have important skills, experience, and knowledge that founders lack—and that startups need in order to scale.

item.title: How Hamas Uses Brutality to Maintain Power
item.description: The group has abused hostages and Palestinians as it wields rough justice in its efforts to maintain control of Gaza and wage an insurgent war.

item.title: Russia Expels 6 U.K. Diplomats as Tensions Mount Over Missiles
item.description: The move came as Vladimir Putin warned the West that allowing Ukraine to use long-range weapons would mean NATO countries were “at war with Russia.”

item.title: Chinese grumble about Beijing’s decision to hike the retirement age: ‘I’ll just have to bear the three extra years of work’
item.description: "Don't feel too sad, everyone; in 15 years, the retirement age will probably be raised again," one Chinese netizen wrote.

item.title: Buckingham Palace is clashing with animal rights groups over the guards’ iconic bearskin caps
item.description: The hats, made of black bear fur, cost more than $2,600 apiece—up 30% from last year.

item.title: I’ve led multiple tech businesses. This is the biggest mistake startup leaders make
item.description: Startup leaders obsessed with valuations and technology overlook something more important at their peril.
